Description: Wooden cosmetic-spoon in the form of a naked swimming woman; incised steatite wig; slot beneath the head for the attachment of the arms and bowl(both now lost).
Curator's comments: Published: Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne, Saint-Gérard 1997, p.135 [152].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 May-Oct, Abbaye Saint-Gerard De Brogne, Le Roman de la momie 1998/9 Oct-Jun, South Carolina, The Charleston Museum, Queens Commoners of the New Kingdom 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed
Acquisition notes: A 'report respecting offers for purchase', 27 Sep 1930, identifies the seller of this object as E. J. Gejou of Paris, and minutes of the Standing Committee 11 Oct 1930 record its purchase (Central Archives; copies in Object Documentation files). The object should be distinguished from the group of ostraca from Amarna (EA 59881ff.), bought of R. Warren Dawson, which are listed immediately afterwards in the acquisitions register (Reg. vol. 11: 112). JHT
